text.title: U S ACTION PROGRAM FOR SUB SAHARAN AFRICA
text.body: The Reagan administration responding to year s United Nations special session on Africa today outlined U S action program sub Saharan Africa focusing heavily on economic reform self help White House statement announced establishment a long term U S goal all U S economic programs policies sub Saharan Africa to end hunger region through economic growth policy reform private sector development statement program action recommended by White House task force set up September series recommendations task force called new efforts to address Africa s heavy debt burden U S food aid should stress production incentives to reinforce African nations economic reform productivity also better African access to world markets should be promoted to reward good performance enable African nations to earn their way toward economic growth U S private sector should be mobilized to provide private voluntary corporate involvement humanitarian donor countries should negotiate through existing International Monetary Fund World Bank coordination process framework agreements each sub Saharan African country to establish long term structural adjustment reform programs task force called separate budget account U S bilateral aid in order to focus better on rewarding economic performance increasing flexibility U S assistance programs incentive economic reforms private sector development

reuters.unknown: V RM f reute u f BC U S HOUSE PANEL TAKE

text.title: U S HOUSE PANEL TAKES FIRST TRADE BILL VOTES
text.author: By Jacqueline Frank
text.body: House trade lawmakers took their first votes on measures designed to toughen U S trade laws but held over until tomorrow most difficult votes on controversial plans to protect American industries Meeting closed session House Ways Means Trade Subcommittee failed to resolve one most sensitive issues bill whether they force major foreign trading partners to severely cut their trade surpluses United States subcommittee considering toned down version Democratic sponsored trade legislation aims to open foreign markets but drops year s effort to force President Reagan to retaliate quotas or tariffs Congressional aides who asked to be identified lawmakers intend to wrap up their proposals tomorrow consider proposal to mandate retaliation without setting specific trade penalties legislation faces another hurdle full Ways Means Committee next week before full House votes on Rep Richard Gephardt Missouri Democrat who seeking his party s presidential nomination he may offer amendment to call reductions trade surpluses those countries barriers to imports U S goods be moderated version his earlier plan to force mandatory ten per cent annual cut trade surplus United States by Japan South Korea Taiwan West Germany other countries largest trade imbalances My criteria good amendment sets standard getting trade deficit down he told reporters trade law changes to become part major congressional administration effort to turn around record U S trade deficit billion dlrs year by opening up foreign markets making U S products more competitive House Speaker James Wright Texas Democrat again today he expects full House approve trade bill by May Reagan accept final congressional bill I expect whatever reported by Ways Means Committee pass We good bill effective bill he told reporters comprehensive trade bill include work by other committees to ease export controls on high technology to aid U S workers displaced by foreign competition to stimulate research development to remove foreign trade barriers to improve education worker training lawmakers agreed first time U S industry could charge foreign producers unfair competition if they deny basic worker rights such as collective bargaining safety rules payment minimum wage appropriate to country s economic development They transferred to U S Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter powers now held by Reagan to decide whether to retaliate against foreign violations fair trade rules whether injured industry deserves import relief They agreed to make easier company to get temporary relief import competition but agreed industry should provide plan to become competitive administration announced support but Yeutter yesterday I am cautiously optimistic Democratic led House come up acceptable bill

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT MITSUBISHI HEAVY FIGHTS BACK
text.author: By Fumiko Fujisaki Reuters
text.body: International efforts to redirect Japan s export driven economy toward domestic consumption face heavy going if country s largest defence contractor world s biggest shipbuilder anything to go by Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd MITH T MHI began making ships iron goods Japan s military rulers years ago responding to strong yen by redoubling efforts to maintain share export markets If we sell best quality cheapest products everyone buy them MHI president Yotaro Iida Although two MHI s main businesses shipbuilding power plant construction been hit hard by yen s pct rise against dollar company no plans to abandon them Iida told Reuters interview other big activity aircraft component manufacture performed so well MHI now accounts half money Tokyo spends on defence procurement each year We made utmost efforts among world s manufacturers to improve productivity he You may be surprised if you come to see our plants outside old but inside ultra modern robots computers Securities analysts at major securities houses agreed MHI pared costs more quickly than competitors company slashed workforce to Despite cost cutting MHI expects profits to drop pct to billion yen current fiscal year ending March s record billion includes gains sale MHI s stake Mitsubishi Motors Corp MIMT T billion yen Iida optimistic future however He resurgence demand Middle East following recent recovery oil prices coupled persistent demand power plants developing countries help MHI restore exports to sales ratio to past decade s average pct MHI s exports to sales ratio fell to pct half year ended September to pct five years ago China most promising market although MHI also considers other non oil producing developing countries as major customers Our customers all seen as being trouble due to lack foreign currency Iida But he added he felt MHI could sell to those markets Japanese government financial support can also finance plants itself recover investment through product sales strategy Iida could prove popular future shipping MHI fighting back against low priced South Korean competition by building more technologically advanced carriers to carry liquefied natural gas other products difficult to transport Shipbuilders Association officials told Reuters MHI world s largest shipbuilder terms orders capacity Domestically MHI involved national projects including development nuclear fusion reactors launch vehicles man made satellites been biggest contractor Japan Defence Agency s F F jet fighters missiles although all these been built under licence U S Firms MHI now heading up five Japanese companies seeking to develop country s own fighter plane to replace currently used F support fighters late s Military experts Washington putting strong pressure on Tokyo to buy U S Plane either McDonnell Douglas Corp F or General Dynamics Corp F to reduce Japan s huge trade surplus U S It might be good idea to jointly produce planes U S Makers as Japan supported by U S Defence umbrella Iida MHI also plans to cooperate U S Strategic Defence Initiative space defence program by participating project when moves research stage he U S been seeking Japan s technological support fiscal aircraft accounted pct MHI s sales shipbuilding pct power plants pct Iida ideal ratio power plants pct aircraft special vehicles pct shipbuilding pct As remaining pct Iida he wanted to shift domestic focus away heavy machinery sold to manufacturers towards household goods but he declined to specify products By end year you may find our brand name on your daily products although does mean we run away our mainstream business he

billion riyals provisions or pct total loans advances to private sector bankers calculated Between Riyad Bank NCB s rival as second biggest two all Saudi shareholding banks covered pct loans advances Investment Bank USCB banks can on lend these to generate profit but generally banks awash liquidity since they unwilling to risk incurring fresh non performing loans while banks more liberal financial markets can attempt to diversify away traditional lending conservatism Saudi banking made difficult to generate fee income new investment banking products One banker Operating earnings Kingdom good reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC TAIWAN CLAMPS NEW CON

text.title: TAIWAN CLAMPS NEW CONTROLS ON CURRENCY INFLOWS
text.author: By Andrew Browne Reuters
text.body: Taiwan s new controls on currency inflows implemented today desperate bid to stem flood speculative money prompted by local currency surge against U S Dollar local foreign bankers central bank now to clear remittances exceeding one U S Dlrs earned exports shipping insurance bank lending plus remittances more than dlrs any other source Petitioners to show their remittances relate to genuine commercial transactions Meanwhile traders no longer required to report all outward payments concerning invisible trade including freight insurance royalties to central bank But bankers they believed new controls be ineffective since businessmen could split up remittances into smaller units or simply remit money through Taiwan s flourishing currency black market bankers controls announced on March panic reaction to U S Pressure intensified over past week faster appreciation Taiwan dollar to slow growth Taiwan s exports to U S government denied local press reports Washington pressing exchange rate up to dlrs Taiwan dollar opened four cents up today at I don t think central bank final target executive U S Bank Other bankers economists they wary making any firm predictions how far Taiwan dollar rise Taiwan s trade surplus U S Hit billion U S Dlrs year against billion surplus widened first two months year to billion dlrs billion same period year Economists estimate up to five billion dlrs speculative money flowed into Taiwan inflow helped boost foreign exchange reserves to more than billion dlrs just under billion time year provided further upward pressure on currency Taiwan dollar appreciated by almost pct against U S Currency since September further encouraging speculators Central bank governor Chang Chi cheng week Washington s pressure plus rising foreign exchange reserves meant further strengthening currency inevitable Many local bankers argue only effective solution to currency problem to drop foreign exchange controls allow local dollar to find own level Lifting exchange controls final answer but central bank prepared to do simply does want to take risk one local banker He he believed new restrictions temporary measure designed to buy time as central bank grapples exchange rate problem restrictions bureaucratic imposition skirt around real issue he Taiwan needs fundamental restructuring foreign exchange controls executive western bank The controls create more paperwork but extra bank charges outweigh profits speculation manager European bank Economists criticised controls saying they could antagonise Washington pushing further economic liberalisation Taiwan Instead liberalising outflows government restricted inflows Kate Newman economist Vickers da Costa local banker who declined to be named It s basically ridiculous s backward movement goes against government s liberalisation programme Taiwan year eased some financial regulations to enable Taiwan nationals to invest foreign government bonds treasury bills certificates deposit to allow individuals to take U S Dlrs cash out country each year

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT PARIS BOURSE REFORM
text.author: By Malcolm Whittaker and Franck Pauly Reuters
text.body: French stockbrokers lose their jealously guarded year old monopoly share trading over next five years under reforms announced on Tuesday by Finance Minister Edouard Balladur But prospect fresh money flooding into their seriously under capitalised share trading business there were few signs regret over gradual passing era It question survival after London s Big Bang private market analyst Edouard Cointreau Balladur long expected reform Bourse structure progressively allow domestic foreign banks to buy stakes stockbrokers capital while at same time brokers be allowed access to money markets project foresees free access to Bourse by January date set opening unified European financial market planned reform expected to be put before Parliament before end Spring session open up capital Paris regional stockbroker houses three stages beginning on January next year aim move following examples Tokyo London opening up their tightly controlled membership to take up challenge European financial integration fierce international competition Balladur announced Cointreau founder chairman private market analysis company Centre d Observation et de Prospective Sociales COPS reform natural development The Paris market rising but cannot go on ever brokers know s good time to sell part their business he told Reuters reform inevitable given European Community directive Ben Williams Paris brokerage house Fauchier Magnan From French point view one cannot be very disappointed he but some brokers must be bit worried as entirely evident all brokerage houses worth lot money He expansion market generally here quality brokerage staff do very well out reforms salary terms But on whole expertise very deep banks already lot such expertise Dealers agreed generally by allowing brokers to reinforce their equity capital reform expected to improve their ability to take large positions stocks bolster liquidity Paris market French Banking Association grouping domestic foreign banks operating here welcomed reforms French banks only won direct access to bond markets September never been happy stockbrokers continuing monopoly on share trading Brokers too soon to say what form links other foreign brokerage houses banks might take Nobody willing to talk yet but one can be sure alliances been formed over past years Williams Some brokers opening up their capital to banks could pose questions such as whether major banks might all aim stakes most prestigious best performing brokerage houses or whether smaller houses might be targetted swallowing up to give banks easy entry onto Bourse Individual banks were reticent over likely strategy their future partners Discussions get underway soon but no specific choice of broker been made yet spokesman Credit Lyonnais who declined to be named Balladur s project does touch on dealing commissions but many dealers question to be addressed since current bank commission higher than brokers because banks who cannot deal directly shares to pay fee to broker they use customer trading According to study by Bourse official watchdog body COB January dealing fees on transaction shares gross total francs were pct if order placed directly by broker against pct same order passed through bank Xavier Dupont Chairman Stockbrokers Association reform mean end to fixed scale commissions He overall reform give French financial markets dynamic efficient organisation But as both brokers bankers commented let s wait see

reuters.unknown: C G L M T f reute d f BC CBT HEAD SAYS POSITIO

text.title: CBT HEAD SAYS POSITION LIMITS HAVE NO PURPOSE
text.author: By Bruce Clark Reuters
text.body: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission CFTC should increase speculative position limits on agricultural futures do away them financial futures Chicago Board Trade CBT chairman Karsten Mahlmann Reporting to CFTC Financial Products Advisory Committee on conclusions so far ad hoc CBT committee on off exchange trading issues Mahlmann We came to conclusion no meaningful purpose served by speculative position limits Position limits were supposed to prevent market manipulation but I submit Exchange CFTC currently all tools necessary to prevent market manipulation whether account speculative or hedge CBT chairman Malmann issue particular concern to CBT because exchange faced increasing competition foreign markets most did position limits He ad hoc committee he also chairs agreed to propose definition hedging be expanded to include risk management as well as risk reduction Mahlmann there danger if category trading given name such as non speculative hedging insurance companies pension funds might be held back engaging by regulatory bodies govern such entities ad hoc committee proposed establishment prudence guidelines list market activities fell within those lines might be lengthened future he committee might also propose CBT itself be allowed to enforce position limits on agricultural futures he added

text.title: CANADA LEADERS FAIL TO SET PACT ON FREE TRADE
text.author: By Russell Blinch
text.body: Prime Minister Brian Mulroney he held frank discussions Canadian province premiers on pace free trade talks United States but longstanding issue provincial ratification remains to be settled Speaking to reporters after nearly five hours meetings premiers Mulroney further discussions be held June September to discuss role provinces approving any new trade deal But he maintained progress being made sweeping talks Unites States got under nearly two years ago It appears reasonable progress being made in talks Mulroney Alberta Premier Don Getty agreed Things running pretty quickly now talks launched by Mulroney s Progressive Conservative government after concerns protectionist sentiment U S aimed reducing remaining barriers between world s largest trading partnership But provinces expected to play major role any new trading arrangement some provincial leaders complained lack progress on reaching ratification formula It s my view we should be thinking these things right now along questions substance agreement commented Ontario Premier David Peterson who been highly critical talks past But Newfoundland Premier Brian Peckford agreement more likely to emerge by consensus there be no need hard fast formula Peckford appears Canada prepared to make concessions to United States on financial services order to make inroads on other bargaining areas such as agriculture Canadian published reports quoting government sources say two countries close to reaching trade deal involve eliminating border tariffs many non tariff barriers over next to years rough draft accord expected to be presented to premiers at June meeting while finished document hoped to be presented to Congress October It s very tight time frame Ontario s Peterson night But at moment tough to say what transpire

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC JAPAN ECONOMY MAY BE

text.title: JAPAN ECONOMY MAY BE NEAR BOTTOM ECONOMISTS SAY
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: The worst may be just over Japan s battered economy but economists they do expect vigorous recovery anytime soon Japanese bank economists polled by Reuters economy s month old slowdown likely to end first half year helped by rising exports stepped up government spending falling prices The economy bottom out middle year Sumitomo Bank Ltd chief economist Masahiko Koido Industrial Bank Japan Ltd senior economist Susumu Taketomi agreed It the bottom offing he But he added recovery be slow Growth fiscal year beginning next month only pick up pct two pct current year he Signs economy just weathered worst increasing volume exports first two months year rose slightly on year on year basis after declining toward end year Although may be due to extraordinary factors such as sharp rise car exports to rebuild depleted European stocks several economists could mark beginning recovery Industrial production fell pct January much smaller than expected forecast by government to rise pct February pct March Bank Japan survey released week showed decline Japanese corporate earnings may be nearing end Paris currency accord month fostered hopes rapid yen rise come to end they Six nations U K Canada France Japan U S West Germany pledged Paris month to stabilise currencies around current levels yen s pct climb against dollar over two years hit export driven economy hard by forcing companies to raise prices lose sales U S Market The important thing exchange rate Taketomi If stabilises firms grow more confident raise investment plant equipment although there no signs yet economists stable yen also help exporters regain some their competitive edge just as U S economy may be starting to recover economists Domestically economy may get boost some loosening government s tight fiscal policy Haruo Muto manager national economics at Bank Tokyo Ltd next reading economy s health should come early next week release gnp figures quarter Most private economists expect rise pct previous quarter third quarter GNP rose pct But senior government official fourth quarter figures could surprise by showing rise more than one point quarter on quarter But he added be statistical aberration significant shift economic activity To maintain year on year growth around pct economy to rise pct fourth quarter as final quarter strong rise fourth quarter probably statistical anomaly repeated final months official Economists fourth quarter figures were also distorted by government s sale gold coins second half Because coins were classified as legal tender their purchase did show up statistics on consumer expenditure Consumer spending also tailed off December because bad weather smaller than normal end year bonuses they As government to buy back some coins retailers because they were unsold government s contribution to economy fourth quarter may been boosted economists Taketomi may received further boost government buying farm products as domestic crop year good senior government official fourth quarter performance domestic sector probably worse than generally expected while external sector better

text.title: U K RETAILERS SEE GROWTH IN CONSUMER SPENDING
text.body: U K Retailers expect consumer spending to accelerate March after disappointing increase February according to monthly survey by Confederation British Industry CBI Fifty nine pct retailers questioned latest Distributive Trades Survey expected sales to be higher March than they were March only six pct expecting lower sales chairman Distributive Trades Survey Panel Nigel Whittaker favourable Budget next week further help sales during summer Figures released earlier week showed retail sales January fell pct mainly due to exceptionally cold weather Sales did recover February as much as retailers expected they now looking better business March today s survey reported clothing stores were most optimistic pct expecting sales March to be higher than year ago Wholesalers also expected stronger sales March while both retailers wholesalers reported slower growth import penetration

reuters.unknown: Y f reute u f BC MOST JAPAN FIRMS NOT

text.title: MOST JAPAN FIRMS NOT RENEWING IRAN TERM CONTRACTS
text.author: By Jennie Kantyka Reuters
text.body: Most Japanese companies decided to renew term contracts to lift Iranian crude oil because spot prices remain considerably lower than OPEC s official levels industry sources They cargo Mideast benchmark crude Dubai traded yesterday at dlrs barrel compared to official price dlrs Only one Japanese company renewed term contract Iranian crude oil second quarter sources sources Japanese companies been lifting total barrels per day bpd Iranian crude under term contracts but only one firm agreed to lift second quarter lifting just to bpd They move could inspire Iran to offer discounts on cargoes loading April but likelihood discounts depended largely on levels spot prices If spot price Dubai goes above dlrs we probably buy Iranian crude at official price one Japanese refiner We don t intend to put pressure on them he added Buyers little incentive to renew contracts to lift oil at official OPEC prices while spot prices on all grades considerably lower oil traders They if spot prices move higher there be no problem finding OPEC crude to purchase at official prices Qatar chartered floating storage crude oil after finding no buyers at official prices March problem likely to recur April adding to country s surplus traders added Iraq dissociated itself OPEC s December production agreement while agreeing to fixed prices But oil analysts if OPEC keeps group output close to first half ceiling bpd supply demand be balanced by end second quarter They also if OPEC holds official price structure based on reference price dlrs spot price fluctuations should be limited to to text.title: SAUDI OUTPUT SAID AT YEAR LOW TO HELP OPEC
text.author: By Philip Shehadi Reuters
text.body: Saudi Arabian oil output fallen to lowest level more than year giving fresh evidence kingdom s determination to keep oil prices at dlrs barrel as agreed by Opec December oil industry sources They Saudi output first eight days March averaged barrels per day bpd including oil neutral zone shared Kuwait compared to February average bpd They Saudi Arabia also selling oil crude oil stocks tankers around world OPEC says must be counted towards member s production quota Saudi Arabia s quota bpd lower production levels indicated Saudi Arabia world s largest oil exporter insisting on getting Opec official prices even at cost lower production sources King Fahd reiterated yesterday interview Reuters television news agency Visnews Saudi commitment to OPEC s December pact to boost oil prices to average dlrs Saudi Arabia completely sticking to OPEC decisions he sources kingdom s exports Gulf ports averaged one bpd during eight days ending Sunday down February average bpd They Saudi Arabia allowing production to fluctuate lifting nominations trying to maintain artificially high levels by putting oil into storage kingdom s main buyers four U S Oil firms past stakes national oil company Aramco Mobil Exxon Texaco Chevron enjoy considerable flexibility timing volume their liftings but bound to pay official prices sources Spot market prices firmed past two weeks but still remain below OPEC levels major buyers delayed liftings hope they improve sources They expected low early March output to pick up towards end month as buyers sought to fulfill their contractual obligations

text.body: An agreement debt rescheduling talks between Philippines commercial bank advisory committee seems to be close at hand David Mulford Assistant Secretary U S Treasury The Philippines negotiations resumed early March agreement now appears to be very near Mulford told debt conference organized by Euromoney magazine Mulford gave no further details He told reporters after his speech he no information on banks response to Philippines revised proposal based on partial payment interest investment notes instead cash Progress Philippines talks following recent agreements Mexico Chile Venezuela help to dispel concerns new debt crisis Mulford told conference However he there continue to be difficulties periods significant risk requiring creative thinking on part banks particular he urged banks to develop menu options supporting debtor reforms as means maintaining broad bank participation new financing packages Mulford banks should be able to offer range options to members lending syndicates provided liquidity value total transactions to debtor nations equivalent to banks new money obligation He more important to find ways encouraging banks to remain syndicates than to find ways enabling them to quit lending groups Mulford his menu options could include more trade credits direct portfolio investments debt equity swaps project loans co financings invesmtent note concept been proposed by Philippines

text.title: NO NEAR TERM BRAZIL COFFEE MOVES EXPECTED
text.author: By Richard Jarvie Reuters
text.body: The Brazilian Coffee Institute IBC unlikely to disclose future export policy until end next week at earliest trade sources IBC president Jorio Dauster meeting government ministers producers exporters market analysts to assess Brazil s position light failure talks London earlier month to set new International Coffee Organization ICO export quotas The failure talks means Brazil got to rethink position completely one Santos exporter meeting National Coffee Policy Council set Thursday March Dauster almost certainly explain his plan to members then before announcing any new measures Dauster told reporters on his return London week no decisions be made on exports before he held talks all sectors industry Exporters Dauster under any great pressure to start marketing coffee immediately World prices been recovering lows followed collapse ICO talks Brazil sold reasonable bags kilos export first four months year exporters key factor eventual opening May June export registrations be amount at contribution quota set little expectation other sales incentive mechanisms such as discounts bonuses price fall guarantees being introduced level quota be decisive determining competitiveness Brazilian coffee on world markets they They noted on February eve planned increase quota April registrations were opened closed after bags were registered export record amount single day If May June registrations opened under similar conditions as before Brazil no difficulty selling at least bags per month The problem be how to limit sales one exporter Brazil s present foreign trade payments problems mean there pressures government to boost exports to maximise foreign exchange earnings However sources they expect IBC to adopt marketing strategy aimed at regaining Brazil s dominant position as exporter but without causing price war General opinion among exporters Brazil plan to export between bags year between be to non members ICO to bags sold to members be around figure Brazil offered to ship if ICO quotas were reintroduced although Dauster offer expired breakdown talks prospects crop at least bags year Brazil capacity to export up to bags after meeting local consumption around sources added However sources Brazil unlikely even to consider exporting such quantities as almost inevitably lead to fall world prices as Brazil tried to encroach on other producers markets Maximum export earnings be achieved by orderly marketing traditional amounts thus re establishing Brazil s market share after year s unusually low exports bags enabling to rebuild stocks maintaining cordial relations producer group backed Brazil s stance at ICO talks they added

reuters.unknown: C G f reute u f BC PORTUGUESE GRAIN AGEN

text.title: PORTUGAL GRAIN AGENCY BARRED FROM IMPORT TENDERS
text.author: By Pascal Fletcher Reuters
text.body: A Portuguese court made preliminary ruling state grain buying agency EPAC should be allowed to take part public import tenders open to private importers grain traders officials Under terms Portugal s January accession to European Community EC grain import monopoly held by EPAC Empresa Publica de Abastecimento de Cereais being reduced by pct annually until all imports liberalised Private traders protested year EPAC being permitted to take part tenders open to them first liberalised pct share country s annual import needs grain oilseed importers association ACICO opened legal proceedings to stop EPAC participating public tenders Miguel Ascensao ACICO told Reuters Lisbon s civil court preliminary ruling decided EPAC should be allowed to take part tenders open to private traders Trade sources ruling though effective immediately subject to appeal to be confirmed further proceedings member government Cereals Market Commission as result court s decision Commission be able to accept offers EPAC public tender being held today import tonnes corn Ascensao court ruling stated EPAC s participation public tenders violated clauses Portugal s EC accession treaty dealing gradual dismantling state agency s import monopoly also participation EPAC still controls national grain storage distribution network unfair competition to private traders Traders they believed EC s Executive Commission unlikely to get involved dispute preferring to leave case to be resolved as internal Portuguese issue They the EC Commission be keeping low profile one trader ACICO says ready to take case to Brussels if necessary

reuters.unknown: V RM f reute u f BC U S RETAIL SALES RI

text.title: U S RETAIL SALES RISE MASKS WEAK TREND ANALYSTS
text.author: By Kathleen Hays Reuters
text.body: U S retail sales rose sharply February but many economists underlying consumer spending trend remains weak February retail sales jumped pct more than pct rise financial markets anticipated But January s sales were revised down to pct drop previously reported pct decline The trend toward continued spending but certainly at much more sluggish pace Don Maude Midland Montagu Capital Markets Inc Maude averaged out wide swings retail sales data over past four months to show pace consumer spending slowing Combining latest data pct drop November pct gain December average retail sales gain over four months pct he compared to to pct rise year over year sales through February You can see pattern developing Maude I wouldn t be surprised to see fall off March especially since sales probably won t be boosted by auto sales as they were February Despite weak underlying trend economists were impressed by robust pct gain total sales excluding autos February compared to revised pct decline January previously reported as pct decline The increase non auto sales broadbased gains durable goods as well as non durables noted Ward McCarthy Merrill Lynch Capital Markets Inc It pretty healthy report He noted building materials rose pct February after falling pct January General merchandise store sales gained pct after pct rise January There signs life economy McCarthy But s jumping to conclusions to extrapolate report into future pct increase disposable personal income January may be linked to new tax laws probably helped boost spending February he A lot people may be inadvertently under withholding taxes their paychecks he When people country get increase disposable income inclination to go out spend he Economists tomorrow s release U S auto sales first days March be important indicator how much sector add to first quarter spending Auto sales accounted lion s share total February sales rising pct followed pct drop January previously reported as pct fall due largely to expiration sales tax deduction under new tax laws January Commerce Department noted Some economists argued because gain total sales excluding autos also followed decline January strength February report less than impressive There strength February data but s because they were compared to low sales levels January Beth Reiners Dean Witter Reynolds Inc We don t see as precursor continued strength Durable goods sales rose pct February after falling pct January February non durable goods sales gained pct after declining pct January Gasoline service station sales rose two pct February following pct gain January but economists higher oil prices rather than increased volume gas sales probably accounted these gains Reiners also emphasized trend consumer spending weakening Total retail sales on average were billion dlrs fourth quarter she January they fell to seasonally adjusted bilion dlrs February rose to billion dlrs On average looks like they ll total to dlrs first quartrer she We don t look at as indication economy barrelling along The number really problematic those us who constructive on bond market agreed Elliot Platt Donaldsen Lufkin Jenrette Securities Corp Platt does foresee potential tighter monetary policy on basis latest retail sales report The Fed on hold now because data been so confusing he Before gain February non farm payroll employment I looked discount rate cut March he But now Fed officials to wait first quarter real U S gross national product data April to sort things out

text.body: The Securities Exchange Commission removed key regulatory obstacle to trading futures on designated foreign debt securities on U S exchanges move allow Chicago Board Trade CBT to apply to Commodity Futures Trading Commission CFTC approval futures contract on yen bonds CBT may apply approval yen bond futures contract CFTC spokesman SEC s action approved by vote specifically removes regulation against trading futures on designated foreign government debt securities on contract markets located country issued those securities Futures on government debt securities Japan Canada Great Britain can already be marketed United States under designated exemption issued by SEC But new move permit U S exchanges to apply to CFTC approval establishing futures contracts on those securities SEC officials new SEC move also allow those foreign government debt securities to be marketed United States by countries other than those issued securities officials Since foreign government securities underlying futures cannot be traded United States unless they registered SEC settlement delivery futures often take place foreign country SEC officials SEC also considering expanding futures trading additional countries government securities to be marketed traded United States officials

text.title: PESSIMISM MOUNTS OVER BAHIAN TEMPORAO COCOA CROP
text.author: By Richard Jarvie Reuters
text.body: Pessimism over effects prolonged dry spell on coming Bahian temporao cocoa crop rising trade forecasts generally to bag range against to fortnight ago Trade sources told Reuters state capital Salvador despite scattered rains since mid February broke six week drought plantations picked up as hoped very little cocoa expected to be gathered first three months May September crop sources arrivals May through July might only reach around bags whereas normal years figure to bags might be expected Arrivals then should start to pick up sharply as pods current flowering gathered However sources noted late temporao always more susceptible to pod rot flourishes if conditions turn cold humid more likely late July on year s crop doubly susceptible because poor prices mean farmers were encouraged to invest fertilisers insecticides also unlikely to treat against pod rot severe attack pod rot can cause loss over bags very short period one source Because increased exposure to pod rot damage estimates final outcome temporao extremely vulnerable production could easily drop to below bag mark if disease hits Although flowering good following start rains pod setting up to expectations possibly because drought caused drop insect population pollinates flowers sources However reports farms indicate moisture levels now generally back to near normal levels current flowering pod setting good should result mature fruit August through September sources they expect no break harvesting beans between end temporao beginning main crop officially starts on October The cut off date completely artificial If things go well now on we should see heavy harvesting without break August through November or even December one If predictions to bag temporao prove accurate be below bag average past years poor temporao when prolonged drought later pod rot cut production to bags lowest since Good growing conditions following year produced temporao bags just below bag record while year s output also suffered some drought damage bags Figures coming temporao might be distorted upwards by inclusion undeclared current main crop beans sources large quantities beans believed to been undeclared year s record total harvest they were unsure how much be unregistered by end official crop year on April Recent official arrivals figures been swollen by inclusion beans been delivered previously to port warehouses but declared Because high turnover beans year significant amounts deteriorated because they were stored too long at back warehouses Some these expected to be held mixing early temporao arrivals official arrivals figures temporao main crops totalling over bags over seven weeks still to go to end year total outturn should be at least record bags if all production declared sources compare previous record set year However there no way telling how many current crop beans be declared after May start temporao thus true size harvest may never be officially registered

reuters.unknown: E F Y f reute r f BC dome pete debt plan

text.title: DOME DMP SAYS MOST LENDERS SUPPORT DEBT PLAN
text.body: Dome Petroleum Ltd majority group major creditors support company s revised proposal to restructure debt more than billion Canadian dlrs Outlining terms plan circulated to lenders earlier week company seeking approval principle proposal within next several weeks order to implement debt rescheduling by June Although at today s price levels only allows company to struggle on benefits appear as oil prices rise Dome chairman J Howard Macdonald statement We believe plan rational one be valid under range circumstances chairman Macdonald lenders previously agreed to interim debt rescheduling until June to allow Dome time to negotiate long term recapitalization debt proposal designed to ensure continued existence company see lenders get maximum recovery their loans Dome plan maintain debt levels within Dome s ability to pay subject to minimum debt service levels each lender Dome debt proposal offers measures such as equity conversion options reclassification to lower interest bearing categories debt to accomplish objectives Under certain circumstances lenders option to convert all or part their debt to common shares at pre determined conversion rate upon plan implementation various conversion rates remain to be set through negotiations company impossible to predict extent to conversion option be exercised amount dilution may result Converting debt to common shares after plan implemented be at much higher conversion price Dome Common shareholders be asked to approve plan before put place Debt remains after share conversion either receive scheduled payments based on contract interest rates to year pay out or interest rates indexed to oil prices company use both annual security to debt ratio test monthly cash flow test to classify interest payments paid on different portions debt To achieve stable operating base company plan provides deducting operating costs capital expenditures general administrative expenses before remaining available cash flow distributed to lenders Dome proposal also assumes efforts continue to operate business as efficiently as possible As company previously debt payments cash flow be divided into two broad categories secured unsecured creditors Terms debt plan include paying institutional unsecured creditors comprising mostly banks who hold private debt cash flow generated by unpledged assets portion get fixed low interest rate under year repayment schedule Remaining institutional unsecured debt get paid through convertible oil indexed unsecured debt matures years or any available excess cash flow or conversion to equity Any institutional lender also option taking all or part debt common shares To offer public unsecured debtholders liquidity Dome they can also convert all or part their debt to common shares when plan implemented Any debt leftover be exchanged convertible debenture interest rate linked to oil prices Secured creditors get paid cashflow generated by assets pledged against their debt under complex formula company Any shortfalls under formula could also be converted to oil linked debentures

text.title: BOLIVIA TO OFFER TO BUY BACK BANK DEBT
text.author: By Paul Iredale Reuters
text.body: Bolivia to make formal offer during next few months to buy back dlrs debt commercial banks at discount up to pct central bank president Jier Nogales Nogales told Reuters interview steering committee Bolivia s creditor banks agreed to consider offer at meeting New York month He offer be based on value Bolivian paper on international secondary debt market where now trades at between pct face value Nogales Bolivia make single offer to buy back commercial debt banks who accepted be paid discounted rate full Banks declined offer be repaid over to years at interest rates below those fixed international markets he added Bolivia frozen payments on medium long term loans to commercial banks since March Nogales there be no money available to restart traditional debt servicing to them some time Several Latin American countries initiated schemes to cancel foreign debt by equity swaps or third party buy backs but Bolivia be first country region to make formal offer to buy back all commercial bank debt at discounted rates Nogales practical strategic considerations determine exact timing offer but be made next few months He Bolivia bargain creditor banks over price to paid debt paper they hold make single non negotiable offer He Bolivia could even pay interest to friendly creditor countries let alone commercial banks only traditional way forward to capitalise interest mean greater bank exposure Bolivia greater loss provisions he added We confident banks going to be reasonable Nogales Now they can resolve their problems once all The most conservative ones who want little more wait year but I don t know if window opportunity be open all time he added Discussing status other parts Bolivia s four billion dlr foreign debt billion owed to governments rest to international agencies Nogales negotiators achieved considerable success recent discussions Paris Club He Paris Club creditors agreed to reschedule Bolivian debt over years five to six years grace while accepting interest be paid until Interest rates were being discussed on bilateral basis under Paris Club rules he added He some Paris Club members agreed to disregard penalty interest payments negotiations were continuing Argentina Brazil who hold dlrs Bolivian debt He Bolivia continuing to service loans international agencies expected to receive up to dlrs disbursements year capital flow loans their servicing changed negative balance dlrs to net inflow dlrs year he added Nogales Bolivia s net international reserves now stood at around dlrs compared to one dlrs disposable funds when government Victor Paz Estenssoro took office August Nogales inflation soared to over pct year government s first month office now down to pct on annualised basis six months plan should continue at level He government also expecting at least three pct growth gdp year after several years negative rates

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC WITCHING

text.title: SEC ASKS NYSE TO TIGHTEN TRIPLE WITCHING PROCESS
text.body: The Securities Exchange Commission asked New York Stock Exchange to tighten experimental procedure used past six months to dampen volatility linked to so called triple witching hour Big Board been collecting publicizing information on large imbalances market on close MOC orders placed on major stocks one half hour before closing on so called expiration Fridays September December Expiration Fridays or triple witching hours occur every three months when stock options stock index options futures on index options expire simultaneously As aribrageurs liquidated their futures options on previous expiration Fridays they sold huge amounts stock they used to offset their positions huge sell orders usually entered market final frantic minutes on expiration Fridays triggered wild price swings stocks serve as basis options futures gyrations prompted SEC September to request Big Board ask members submit all MOCs by hrs on expiration Fridays then be made public giving market half hour to settle order imbalances But March letter to NYSE President Robert Birnbaum SEC Director Market Regulation cited problems experimental procedure during Dec expiration Friday large number MOC buy orders were placed until after EST on Dec helped send Dow Jones Industrial Average up points final minutes day to point gain on day Ketchum Citing SEC s concern such trading Ketchum asked exchange to tighten procedure by accepting any pre existing MOC orders after if they could been placed earlier new restriction SEC officials merely clarifies terms existing experimental procedure bar liquidation stocks through MOC orders arbitrage purposes after hrs even if they offset other reported order imbalances those stocks only MOC orders SEC allow to be placed after EST on March next expiration Friday those received by Big Board member firms after EST help reduce existing order imbalances Ketchum If there no published imbalances particular stock no MOC orders be accepted stock he If dissemination MOC orders to provide accurate indication true order imbalances then all existing MOC orders must be submitted by p m only those new MOC orders responding to reported imbalances can be permitted Ketchum letter did say how SEC or NYSE determine difference between pre existing MOC orders be barred new MOC orders be allowed to reduce imbalances But SEC official agency hopes NYSE members adhere to rules in spirit cooperation

reuters.unknown: RM F A f reute u f BC FED DATA INDICATE NO

text.title: FED DATA INDICATE NO POLICY CHANGE LIKELY
text.author: By Martin Cherrin Reuters
text.body: U S bank reserve monetary discount window borrowings data released by Federal Reserve today clearly indicate policy on hold may be changed weeks or even months economists The Fed keeping policy at dead center to change policy unless something fairly dramatic occurs on economy John Williams Bankers Trust Co These numbers contain no hint policy shift prospect nor do economic or financial developments argue policy change William Griggs Griggs Santow Inc Fed data released today were all line economists expectations similar to numbers recent weeks Fed net discount window borrowings two weeks ended Wednesday averaged dlrs up dlrs February statement period but little changed dlrs period before banks net free reserves latest two weeks averaged dlrs versus dlrs previously Finally Fed M money supply fell dlrs February broader M measure down billion dlrs M up even three billion dlrs Analysts M month grew at negative pct annual rate compared minus pct M actual positive growth pct annualized M February levels M M left aggregates billion dlrs under their respective upper growth limits set by Fed annual growth target both to pct There no M target In near term there absolutely no reason Fed to ease policy even apart slowdown money growth Stephen Slifer economist at Lehman Government Securities Inc Economists generally expect modest pickup monetary growth March after February s anemic growth rates However they stress money growth be strong enough to prevent Fed dropping interest rates further if economy shows evidence weakness Commenting on February s decline key M aggregate Slifer main cause billion dlr drop money market deposits at banks number risen three to four billion dlrs month long while he so February s weakness likely to persist Slifer expects modest M M growth rates to four pct during March Griggs M M coming months should return to five to seven pct annualized growth region so continue to present no problem Fed Economists Fed appears to be very comfortable current policy stance likely to wait perhaps several more months economic data before deciding whether or to ease grip on reserves Given economy s fragility many sectors analysts agreed there almost no chance Fed choose to raise rather than lower interest rates when next changes policy Discount window borrowings past week were as low as Fed can get them although Fed funds held above six pct Williams Bankers Trust Funds averaged pct week to Wednesday up pct prior week Fed added reserves indirectly via one billion dlrs customer repurchase agreements Friday billion dlrs on Monday two billion dlrs on Wednesday On Tuesday added reserves directly through two day System repurchases Williams Griggs agreed Fed let funds rate be largely market driven They focusing instead on borrowings target around dlrs

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute u f BC PHILIPPINE DEBT TALKS

text.title: PHILIPPINE DEBT TALKS FINELY POISED BANKERS SAY
text.author: By Alan Wheatley Reuters
text.body: Debt talks between Philippine government bank advisory committee were delicately poised after brief meeting between two sides today bankers sources close to Philippine delegation We businesslike meeting made good progress banker The banks anxious to come to agreement But bankers were reluctant to predict whether talks end successfully Caution also evident Philippine camp We feel ball s banks court one source two sides meet again on Friday talks Philippines seeking to reschedule billion dlrs debt now dominated by discussion innovative proposal made by finance minister Jaime Ongpin to pay part country s interest bill Philippine Investment Notes PINs instead cash Manila wants to pay London Interbank Offered Rate cash to issue PINs respect margin above LIBOR banks rejected original PINs proposal Friday but Ongpin presented revised proposal on Monday sought to satisfy banks objections by guaranteeing notes yield pct over LIBOR cash banks apparently yet to pass final judgment on new proposal Senior Reagan Administration officials expressed warm support PINs proposal week gave Ongpin hope banks embrace idea But banks still being circumspect weighing possible accounting consequences as well as considering precedents they set if they agreed to PINS One main architects PINs proposal U S lawyer Lee Buchheit adamant banks nothing to worry To extent s precedent s precedent to be encouraged Buchheit partner Cleary Gottlieb Steen Hamilton told debt equity swaps conference sponsored by Euromoney magazine Under proposal banks sell dollar denominated PINs at discount to multinational firms convert them into pesos at face value to fund government approved equity investments Philippines effect international firms be paying part Manila s interest bill allowing government to conserve much needed hard currency One beauties scheme according to Buchheit widens scope third world debt negotiations been confined to debtors creditors past years There s another pool cash at table now he David Mulford Assistant Secretary U S Treasury told Euromoney conference ideas such as PINs should be part menu options available to banks instead pure new money packages He difficulty syndicating Mexico s billion dlr loan package shows new approaches must be encouraged We must face fact greater flexibility devising new money packages may effect be essential to future bank syndications Mulford unusually frank comment Mexican deal he dissatisfaction Mexico s economic program criticism communication coordination within bank syndicate prompted number banks to refuse to participate loan refusal for time appeared to jeopardize prospects successful agreement rest banks Mulford Mexican package now due to be signed on March but bankers U S clearly feels need to breathe new life into financing process especially crucial negotiations Brazil to start banks their part insist they more than willing to discuss Mulford s menu say debtors need to be more flexible example they say financing talks Argentina proving tough because Buenos Aires dislikes debt equity schemes onlending provisions banks promoting But whether banks ready to endorse PINs concept right away still hangs balance

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC U S OFFICIALS DISAGR

text.title: U S OFFICIALS DISAGREE ON REDUCING BUDGET DEFICIT
text.body: Senior U S Economic officials disagree on likelihood government can meet budget deficit reduction targets Beryl Sprinkel chairman Council Economic Advisers reiterated Reagan Administration s opposition to tax increase pledge to reduce deficit by cutting spending fostering economic growth By contrast Rudolph Penner Director Congressional Budget Office budget process broken down deficit remain close to billion dlrs fiscal Sprinkel told symposium sponsored by New York University spending could be cut by avoiding decisions based on desire to influence votes by shifting responsibility local projects to state governments He also suggested line item veto allows President to veto parts bill without rejecting all to limit wasteful spending Spending taxing decisions should be linked more closely Sprinkel Administration still looks pct growth U S Real gross national product GNP pct Asked if latest economic reports signal rate economic growth attainable Sprinkel It looks pretty good to me We ve two very strong employment reports He also federal reserve policy appropriate adding It looks like they re on track While further reductions needed trade deficit Sprinkel lower dollar having impact new tax laws hurt economy tax reform act significantly lowers tax rates greatly increase private production incentives he Our estimates at Council Economic Advisers suggest national net output goods services permanently increase by approximately two pct because long run consequences tax reform Sprinkel In amounted to increase approximately dlrs income average American family Sprinkel also argued tax cuts were responsible large increase budget deficit fiscal ending September federal spending amounted to pct GNP while federal receipts absorbed pct GNP leaving deficit pct he Sprinkel compared fiscal federal expenditure share GNP percentage points higher revenue share GNP virtually same Contrary to conventional wisdom therefore tax cut root cause extraordinary budget deficits past few years Sprinkel This tax cut merely rolled back inflation induced tax increases occurred between he added However Congressional Budget Office s Rudolph Penner argued tax cut misguided Since making big mistake cutting taxes enormously without any plan to decrease spending by Administration or Congress indeed increases defence spending now all options for reducing budget deficit unpleasant he Penner tax cut resulted ideological turmoil U S Caused by biggest sustained inflation our nation s history helped foster widespread distrust government The American people turned on government tax revolt at state level new demands on government at national level Penner But their dislike taxes exceeded their general dislike spending programs Now correction mistake demands system change lot Penner sees little hope Gramm Rudman Hollings budget deficit reduction targets be met deficit remain at roughly billion dlrs year He budget process sets targets arbitrarily likely to succeed I feel pretty safe saying any process tries to dictate numerical outcome above doomed to fail simply because there s no Way to enforce Penner Penner questioned methods by budget deficit cut He to billion dlrs were eliminated by one time measures such as temporary increase taxes related to tax reform sales government assets Another four billion dlrs cut by what I call creative timing changes like moving military payday day fiscal to first day fiscal saved more than two billion dlrs Penner

rising rapidly because improving living standards rising demand sweet drinks cakes biscuits other sugary foods It be easy to cut domestic demand even state controlled economy China may to import he output at down domestic demand at six tonnes In two years acreage under sugar cane beet fallen sugar mills underutilised output dropped cannot meet demand rising every day The country to continue reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC TAX REVENUES BOOST U

text.title: TAX REVENUES BOOST U K BUDGET OPTIONS
text.author: By Sten Stovall Reuters
text.body: A mix electoral boldness fiscal caution expected Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson next week when he unveils his budget fiscal Exceptionally robust tax revenues given Lawson very favourable budget options to please voters industry financial markets alike budget Lawson s fourth probably Conservative government before next general election political analysts say Analysts major budget question how Lawson balance expected tax cuts lower public borrowing allow fresh falls U K Interest rates They boost given to economy by consumer spending helped reduce Public Sector Borrowing Requirement PSBR financial originally targetted billion stg despite big rises government spending Economists say Lawson may up to five billion stg to split between income tax cuts other electoral sweeteners higher spending drop borrowing while still meeting his earlier PSBR target billion stg decision facing Lawson how best to use so called fiscal adjustement to maximise government s all round popularity ahead next general election Economist Ian Harwood Warburg Securities Lawson s budget must strike balance between tax cuts aimed at home consumption lower public borrowing attracting support overseas investors Peter Fellner James Capel Co a budget concentrates on tax cuts consumer be budget early election Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher must call poll before June But anticipation summer or autumn ballot risen as opposition Labour Party slipped voter surveys Forecasts economy may deteriorate later year add to arguments early poll analysts say Conservatives pledged to cut basic rate taxation U K current pct level to pct While confirming aim Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher month seemed to dash speculation happen near future She television interview happen Eventually But I think be eventually Most market analysts now expect two pence reduction basic rate taxation lowering top rate income tax pct one billion stg cut PSBR to six billion stg considered minimum needed reassuring financial markets they add Treasury s inflow tax receipts far surpassed previously envisaged economists say Lawson as recently as December I very much doubt whether there be much scope reductions taxation next year s budget Conservative government eager to get basic rate tax down to pct as soon as possible since every pound off tax base make opposition Labour Party s spending plans look more painful to electorate analysts say direct revenue effect one penny change basic rate income tax be billion stg billion stg Treasury figures show Lawson s budget speech to Parliament on Tuesday starts at GMT sure to echo government s distinct tone optimism analysts say tax measures Lawson expected to announce be based firmly on positive assessment past economic achievements confidence future they add But even if he does cut his planned PSBR by between one billion stg as most economists predict Lawson still likely to find himself announcing higher PSBR than outturn financial year M could leave him presentation problem economists say lower PSBR raise financial confidence by reassuring markets borrowing burden imposed by government stay low even if certain key aspects budget s arithmetic seem over optimistic economists say Lawson slated to reaffirm government s goals as set out Medium Term Financial Strategy MTFS reducing inflation raising economic growth Regarding monetary targets some analysts expect him to drop wayward broad money aggregate sterling M while retaining tamer M narrow measure Few foresee any other monetary aggregate being chosen by Lawson formal targeting Analysts were surprised week when government sanctioned half percentage point cut interest rates attempt to cool down sterling gilts market Analysts expected authorities to wait until after budget Further declines bank base lending rates anticipated after budget Many analysts foresee them falling by as much as full percentage point current pct level main electoral attraction reducing interest rates to cut mortgage borrowing costs thus reduce inflation analysts say Each one percentage point cut mortgage rate reduces retail prices by pct government figures show

text.title: U S OFFICIALS DISAGREE ON REDUCING DEFICIT
text.body: Senior U S Economic officials disagree on likelihood government can meet budget deficit reduction targets Beryl Sprinkel chairman Council Economic Advisers reiterated Reagan Administration s opposition to tax increase pledge to reduce deficit by cutting spending fostering economic growth By contrast Rudolph Penner Director Congressional Budget Office budget process broken down deficit remain close to billion dlrs fiscal Sprinkel told symposium sponsored by New York University spending could be cut by avoiding decisions based on desire to influence votes by shifting responsibility local projects to state governments He also suggested line item veto allows President to veto parts bill without rejecting all to limit wasteful spending Spending taxing decisions should be linked more closely Sprinkel Administration still looks pct growth U S Real gross national product GNP pct Asked if latest economic reports signal rate economic growth attainable Sprinkel It looks pretty good to me We ve two very strong employment reports He also federal reserve policy appropriate adding It looks like they re on track While further reductions needed trade deficit Sprinkel lower dollar having impact new tax laws hurt economy tax reform act significantly lowers tax rates greatly increase private production incentives he Our estimates at Council Economic Advisers suggest national net output goods services permanently increase by approximately two pct because long run consequences tax reform Sprinkel In amounted to increase approximately dlrs income average American family Sprinkel also argued tax cuts were responsible large increase budget deficit fiscal ending September federal spending amounted to pct GNP while federal receipts absorbed pct GNP leaving deficit pct he Sprinkel compared fiscal federal expenditure share GNP percentage points higher revenue share GNP virtually same Contrary to conventional wisdom therefore tax cut root cause extraordinary budget deficits past few years Sprinkel This tax cut merely rolled back inflation induced tax increases occurred between he added However Congressional Budget Office s Rudolph Penner argued tax cut misguided Since making big mistake cutting taxes enormously without any plan to decrease spending by Administration or Congress indeed increases defence spending now all options for reducing budget deficit unpleasant he Penner tax cut resulted ideological turmoil U S Caused by biggest sustained inflation our nation s history helped foster widespread distrust government The American people turned on government tax revolt at state level new demands on government at national level Penner But their dislike taxes exceeded their general dislike spending programs Now correction mistake demands system change lot Penner sees little hope Gramm Rudman Hollings budget deficit reduction targets be met deficit remain at roughly billion dlrs year He budget process sets targets arbitrarily likely to succeed I feel pretty safe saying any process tries to dictate numerical outcome above doomed to fail simply because there s no Way to enforce Penner Penner questioned methods by budget deficit cut He to billion dlrs were eliminated by one time measures such as temporary increase taxes related to tax reform sales government assets Another four billion dlrs cut by what I call creative timing changes like moving military payday day fiscal to first day fiscal saved more than two billion dlrs Penner

reuters.unknown: A RM f reute u f BC U S URGES BANKS TO D

text.title: U S URGES BANKS TO DEVELOP NEW RD WLD FINANCE
text.author: By Peter Torday
text.body: The United States week signaled pressing commercial banks increasingly disenchanted providing large cash loans to debtor nations to develop new ways financing prove more acceptable to both sides Heading off challenges to Third World debt strategy U S officials also say they think concessions should be made to debtors enact reforms speeding inflation free growth particular they stress new techniques shift emphasis debt to equity shave interest rates The strategy sufficiently broad as initiative or concept there can be additional emphasis such as debt equity swaps sort thing Reagan administration official slow pace commercial bank lending to Third World The debtors been performing well some people argue taking pct down to pct debt forgiveness Well if s what fine What really narrowing spread could be charged on new money official week therefore U S officials signaled their backing novel proposal by Philippines called partial payment interest tradeable investment notes On Tuesday officials Treasury Secretary James Baker told Secretary State George Shultz idea creative one signaled his approval to Philippine Finance Minister Jamie Ongpin later day administration official told Reuters week Philippines proposal to partially pay interest investment notes instead cash should be considered seriously by banks agreement banks officials now say expected soon New bank lending been slow materializing but fact matter there been billion dlrs bank loans restructured form extension credit As you know there s been billion dlrs new money official who plays key role keeping plan afloat plan launched October by Secretary Baker called on commercial multilateral banks to lend billion dlrs subsequent three years to major debtors undertaking reforms promoting economic growth But taken almost six months to complete syndication billion dlrs loan to Mexico created deep misgivings here liklihood such large straight cash loans being assembled ever again U S officials want banks only to consider swapping their debts equity local corporations development already met success Chile Mexico but to pin loans on specific projects finance trade invest directly debtor country private sectors These forms lending they say give banks greater stake more economically secure return on investment major challenge to U S plan Brazil month declared moratorium on interest payments followed up world tour by officials seeking political way out billion dlr debt burden country beset by falling trade surplus dwindling reserves endangering ability to service foreeign debt at billion dlrs Third World s largest One official attending Washington talks Brazilian Finance Minister Dilson Funaro they ve come here now Look we re out money help us but they haven t come plan they ve gone all over world at every stop they ve been told same thing official Brazil to enact credible economic program either consultation World Bank or International Monetary Fund to cool overheated economy before commercial banks begin negotiations As result Brazilian action private banks major debtor nations redoubled their efforts to reach agreements stretching out debt repayments part administration signaled strong support new techniques some cases effectively amount to interest rate concessions major debtor nations pressed banks to allow Chile to make annual instead bi annual interest payments speeding accord Administration officials who asked to be named also debated whether to allow banks greater flexibility building up loan loss reserves against Third World loans debate centers on rule known as FASB under banks experiencing delayed interest payments on real estate loans need set aside reserves against debt principal if believed payments resume More recently rule extended to cover farm energy loans Senator Bill Bradley New Jersey Democrat suggested should be extended to Third World loans Bradley prominent among Congressmen urging provisions debt relief be attached to tough new trade legislation now being considered on Capitol Hill But officials debate been inconclusive

text.title: CME BOARD LIMITS BUT DOES NOT BAN DUAL TRADING
text.body: The Chicago Mercantile Exchange s CME board directors issued letter to members sets limits but does ban dual trading S P futures options pit rules prohibit brokers who execute customer orders to trade their own account or engage dual trading top step pit board defines as geographically advantageous position pit Brokers who engage dual trading other areas pit must record to nearest minute those personal trades board also set as yet unspecified percentage limits on trades brokers can conduct among broker groups otherwise known as trading rings By issuing own rules CME s board rejected petition presented February by some CME members sought to prohibit dual trading any kind S P pits full CME membership vote on petition since rejected by board by April If members reject petition board be free to implement rules CME spokesman However members can vote to adopt petition institute total ban on dual trading board s rules on dual trading if implemented prohibit brokers trading their own account once they executed customer order top step pit It s step right direction stock futures analysts William Marcus Donaldson Lufkin Jenrette Inc It s very difficult to engage large broker business anywhere but top step he If there were abuses the rules should act to curb them Marcus added spokesman CME tenor board directors letter to members appears to leave open possibility additional limits on dual trading addition limits set forth so far to be more closely defined

text.body: Citicorp denied financial market rumors written off some loans to Latin American debtors Rumors we written off any our Latin American debt unfounded Citicorp spokesman told Reuters response to London based rumors money markets Citicorp largest bank group U S one biggest lenders to Latin America some eight to nine billion dlrs outstanding to Brazil Mexico Argentina bank analysts response to more specific market rumors taken action on exposure to Brazil Citicorp made K filing on subject Securities Exchange Commission on Tuesday relation to registration statement preferred stock issue Citing filing Citicorp Brazil s recent suspension interest payments on billion dlrs commercial bank debt related actions may require Citicorp to place billion dlrs intermediate long term Brazilian loans on cash basis When loans placed on cash basis interest or principal payments only booked when received instead being accrued on their due dates analysts noted However Citicorp K filing it premature to make such decision at time view fluidity situation management s high confidence long term outlook Brazil Brazil s new central bank governor Francisco Gros met senior commercial bankers here on Wednesday Citicorp formal talks on Brazil s recent actions future financing needs should begin the near future Citicorp filing the issue be re evaluated at end first quarter bank group continued if decided these loans to Brazil should be placed on cash basis Citicorp estimates based on existing interest rates impact first quarter be approximately dlrs after tax full year be approximately dlrs after tax added these amounts include interest accrued yet been collected Although Citicorp denied earlier rumors major loan writedowns warning may to place some Brazilian loans on non accrual unnerved many Wall Street investors common stock price down one dlr to after first hour on volume over shares However Lawrence Cohn analyst at Merrill Lynch Co Inc market s nervousness really warranted Citicorp can afford he The amounts they talking peanuts M

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT EMS MARKS EIGHTH BIRTHDAY
text.author: By Tony Carritt Reuters
text.body: The European Monetary System marks eighth anniversary still vulnerable to turmoil world money markets despite creating island currency rate stability Europe economists say But many economists say system holds eight European Community currencies within narrow fluctuation bands remains infancy new currency European Currency Unit Ecu been runaway success investors borrowers alike seeking alternative to volatile dollar on Wednesday long term vision Ecu as Europe s common currency took step nearer to becoming reality when Belgium minted world s first Ecu coin But economists say members such as West Germany so far blocked second stage development envisaged by system s founding fathers ex West German Chancellor Helmut Schmidt former French President Valery Giscard d Estaing Under phase originally due to started two years after EMS set up decision making to been transferred national governments central banks to autonomous European Monetary Fund But members jealously guarded their sovereignty economic monetary matters The basic problem EMS governments prepared to make quantum leap to situation where certain decisions taken common one economist who closely watched system s development result EC often divided over policy on third currencies accentuating what economists say system s greatest weakness vulnerability to weak dollar Over past months as U S Dollar plunged investors moved into strong currencies resulting sharp rise West German mark severely strained system MORE As mark soared against dollar also rose against EMS currencies less favoured by international investors as West Germany year refused to give pressure several EC partners United States to cut interest rates to slow mark s rise EMS to be realigned twice to ease financial trade strains within community Two months ago mark Dutch guilder were revalued by three pct Belgian Luxembourg francs by two pct against other currencies system French franc Italian lira Irish punt Danish crown Another frustration been Britain s failure to lend EMS political support by keeping pound still major world currency outside system No change British government s attitude expected before country s next general elections due by mid Meanwhile system s realignment th since set up prompted European finance ministers to ask EC s highly secretive Monetary Committee Committee Central Bank Governors to come up suggestions reinforcing Their ideas due to be unveiled when finance ministers hold informal meeting Belgium early next month But economists proposals unlikely to involve more than tinkering technical details They sceptical chances any fundamental change Technical measures won t be enough to protect EMS against external factors such as dollar weakness we must take step forward to institutional level Leo de Corel Kredietbank s economic research department Economists say system s fortunes now depend largely on success agreement month among major industrial nations to stabilise exchange rates If dollar resumes slide EMS could be more turbulence they predict

text.body: Negotiations on new International Natural Rubber Agreement INRA approaching make or break point prospects future pact appear to be balance delegates Manaspas Xuto Thailand chairman INRA renegotiation conference holding consultations small group producers consumers to try to resolve major outstanding issues When talks began on Monday Xuto those issues should be settled by end first week to allow time to draft agreement during second week talks due to until March Xuto There nothing concrete yet but atmosphere good discussions expected to continue late into night Xuto he may hold weekend meetings Delegates negotiations now focus on degree to price adjustments should be automatic At present if market price been above or below reference price set at Malaysian Singapore cents kilo current agreement six months reference price revised by five pct or by amount decided by International Natural Rubber Organisation council Consumers asking these circumstances adjustment be automatic at five pct or more Producers want council to word resisted reducing role price adjustment procedure Delegates there seems to be optimism settling another issue floor price now appears consumers may consider dropping their insistence downward adjustment floor price called lower indicative price under certain circumstances means any possible compromise centre on reference price may buy or may sell must buy or must sell levels without changing lower indicative price set at Malaysian Singapore cents current pact Delegates exchange consumer flexibility on floor price question producers may consider agreeing to another consumer proposal more frequent price reviews at month intervals instead at present
