text.title: FRN PANIC INITIATED EXACERBATED BY MARKET MAKERS
text.author: By Norma Cohen and Dominique Jackson Reuters
text.body: Today s panic floating rate note market been simmering months many ways market makers own doing traders bank officials For six months there been series crises FRN market Each cut deeper deeper into very fibre market senior official at U S Bank As prices fallen he explained underwriters who originally brought issues retreated They divested themselves paper as quickly as possible unwilling to bear losses magnitude seen recent panic trading virtual effective closure market perpetual floaters month bankers witnessed consequences kind contraction liquidity investor confidence Fears were engendered possibility crisis infecting market conventional dated FRN issues almost times as large as perpetuals estimated billion dlrs debt outstanding The professionals so nervous holding inventory they sell at any price official at leading U S Bank explaining panic selling pushed prices down sharply over two days Bankers FRN traders emphasised today s trading unique driven exclusively by professionals there nothing fundamentally wrong securities they sold highlighting point dealers noted benchmark issues FRN market two FRN s U K Launched fell unprecedented basis points respectively at opening morning Certainly dealers Britain no less credit worthy today than yesterday country s economic health currently appears better than some time Pointing out kind sovereign supra national debt sagged on any fundamental weakness one senior FRN source The idiocy situation aptly shown by fact these kind borrowers can now tap syndicated loan markets at rates lower than their floaters currently pay Dealers agreed banking sector paper constitutes significant part market currently under pressure Floating rate debt major U S Canadian banks eased markedly nervous trading month on renewed investor fears banks exposure to Latin American debt U S Canadian money centre bank FRNs along Republic Ireland paper were hard hit again week dealers citing one heavily traded Citicorp note falling to levels so low now effectively yielding basis points over Libor the London Interbank Offered Rate By comparison dlr note matures yielded only fine basis point over Libid the London Interbank Bid Rate when issued January year Price declines size can really only be explained by understanding operating practices leading players market dealers banking analysts This to be understood as matter between banks who brief to buy low sell high one U S Bank source noted Another senior source at U K Bank drew attention to enormous overhead costs high salaries generated over few years FRN market to be justified But even beyond cost running FRN trading desk dealers way securities bought sold Although sophisticated on screen dealing exists most markets euro markets trading conducted by telephone If somebody calls you up asks you to make him price any issue you do he can say Right You own five trader explaining market practice unfortunate buyer then forced to unload securities just minutes later to yet another firm at even lower price trader explained precisely phenomenon forced rapid downward price spiral earlier today traders adding likely to continue until markets either regain their confidence or market practices change One possible solution dealers be to initiate trading exclusively through brokers screens so only those who wanted to buy bonds to lift bid or buy at price Meanwhile bank regulators apparently concerned implications collapse FRN prices Traders London Bank England called around to market makers asking whether they intended to continue trading what they calculated losses to be Bank often makes periodic checks market but dealers latest enquiries were more specific spokesman Bank England able to comment immediately on Bank s action One trader at major U S Bank here addition Federal Reserve Bank New York s international capital markets unit phoned banks London today seeking information trading FRN s He also unusual procedure

reuters.unknown: F f reute d f BC PROPOSALS TO RELAX U

text.title: PROPOSALS TO RELAX U S DRUG LAWS POSE PROBLEMS
text.author: By Marjorie Shaffer Reuters
text.body: The Reagan Administration s soon to be published proposals to make experimental therapies more rapidly widely available to terminally ill patients pose product liability problems drug companies experts pharmaceutical field Details proposals be published Federal Register shortly become effective after day comment period Under proposed policy announced Tuesday by Commissioner Food Drugs Frank E Young at press conference patients life threatening diseases who enrolled clinical trials be allowed access to experimental therapy policy also allows drug companies to sell promising drugs to patients Previously drugs like AZT could be rushed into wider use free of charge if agent shown to be effective Under new policy FDA could only refuse to permit physician to administer experimental drug if shown to be unsafe Financial analysts plan likely benefit biotechnology companies few or no products approved marketing U S but little economic impact on large drug companies many other sources revenue Charging fee still experimental drugs could help biotech companies near term financial situation help make them less dependent on outside sources Teena Lerner biotech analyst at L F Rothchild Other observers were concerned drug companies be put into legal bind if promising drugs later proved to devastating side effects Before lot drug companies release these drugs they going to to think long hard liability the product liability problems enormous Washington based lawyer who specializes drug field Patients clinical trials normally sign lengthy informed consent papers before taking investigational drug lawyer no more than two cases gone to trial suits against drug company s investigational drug The new proposals whole new kettle fish lawyer Drug companies right now probably meeting their insurance companies Burroughs Wellcome Co U S arm British firm Wellcome PLC makes AZT Merck Co Inc MRK Hoffman LaRoche Inc SmithKline Beckman Corp SKB too soon to comment on policy I m very uncomforable Wellcome spokeswoman Kathy Bartlett We haven t chance to formulate response yet s too early But some financial analysts say proposals benefit drug companies I find proposal to be very significant alteration FDA s past policies should positively affect drug companies stocks drug analyst Davis Saks Morgan Olmstead Kennedy Gardner Saks also warned many health care providers balk at proposal call amoral to charge patients life threatening diseases drugs otherwise be given out free clinical trials Jeffrey Warren spokesman Pharmaceutical Manufacturers Association represents major drug firms U S A mechanism already exists at FDA permitting certain seriously ill patients access to experimental drugs perhaps system can be approved Warren acknowledged PMA may be able to come up consensus among membership when rules formally published He also admitted product liability problems could be concern to major drug companies Jeffrey Levi executive director National Gay Lesbian Task Force actively AIDS policy funding issues cited drug Suramin Bayer AG BAYRY shown early promise as AIDS treatment but on wider clinical testing shown to deadly side effects

reuters.unknown: E F A RM f reute r f BC TALKING POINT DOME PE

text.title: TALKING POINT DOME PETROLEUM DMP
text.author: By Larry Welsh Reuters
text.body: Dome Petroleum Ltd s revised debt restructuring plan keeps company alive improves appeal as takeover target but full debt repayment depends on sharp oil price rise oil banking analysts Dome s complex proposal to let creditors link some or all their debt to oil indexed debentures or convert to equity very cut dried to point Peters Co Ltd Calgary based energy analyst Wilf Gobert Dome is saying way There isn t enough money to pay you back he added plan strikes me as very pragmatic thing to do First Marathon Securities Ltd oil analyst Jim Doak commented He plan seeks to formally tie payments to creditors price oil governs Dome s cash flow ability to service debt Dome expects total debt to reach billion Canadian dlrs by June when interim debt rescheduling plan expires Dome hopes to implement long term plan Gobert plan rank secured unsecured creditors complex series repayment categories or an agreed pecking order what your creditors claim to assets Potential suitors find Dome easier to swallow under debt restructuring plan because proposes to resolve competing claims on assets pledged to secured creditors on remaining unpledged assets Gobert others Certainly restructuring plan once s agreed to put place going to make easier someone to come look at doing deal on acquiring company Gobert remarked It s going to be lot easier than right now because you ll settled pecking order question he added Gobert believes debt plan may be partly motivated by desire to sell Dome Petroleum as whole If creditors wanted to liquidate their bank loans they could do orderly fashion through sale company as opposed to dismemberment he Dome s proposal includes rescheduling secured debt payments over to year schedule linking payments to cash flows generated by assets pledged against loans establishing interest rates allow changing oil prices Creditors only real alternative to Dome s plan an asset grab liquidate company at distress prices banks spend next years court deciding who what asset First Marathon s Doak Dome s creditors plan does offer quick method to recover loans but extends payment time hope oil prices rise increasing amount company s debt payments Merrill Lynch Canada Inc bank analyst Terry Shaunessy plan is solution says give me more time let s keep our fingers crossed oil goes way up Doak Shaunessy estimated oil prices to rise to to U S dlrs barrel to fully service all company s debt Analysts plan ensure company continues to operate but provides little other benefit to common shareholders From common shareholder standpoint all does sort keep him on life support system because there isn t any equity unless you get big increase oil prices Gobert remarked Analysts Dome s common shares trading today at dlrs off four cents on Toronto Stock Exchange essentially represent long term warrant pegged to oil prices You to be looking at extremely high price oil context historical trends before there s any residual value common shareholders analyst Doak While Dome s plan lenders be able to convert debt to common shares amount dilution depends on share conversion prices still to be negotiated how much lenders choose to convert company

text.title: WHITE HOUSE SAID HOLDING OFF DECISION ON BUDGET
text.author: By Michael Posner Reuters
text.body: Congressional budget leaders asking President Reagan to join bipartisan effort or even summit to write new budget but White House chief staff Howard Baker no decision been made yet Senate source request White House cooperation made yesterday by Senate Budget Committee chairman Lawton Chiles at meeting Baker source appeal came as Senate Budget Committee made plans to start drafting next Tuesday fiscal budget plan Democrats controlling Congress hope to get through both chambers by April House Democrats been meeting privately continue discussions on Tuesday to develop plan full committee holds first drafting meeting Thursday Reagan s own budget submitted January but Congress generally rejected as unrealistic Congressional Budget Office saying deficit understated should be more realistic billion dlrs Among major controversial decisions Congress to make levels deficit deductions to meet Gramm Rudman budget law target cutting estimated billion dlr deficit to billion dlrs key decisions amount new revenues Reagan proposed some billion dlrs asset sales excise taxes as part deficit cutting plan Reagan who opposes new taxes refuses to say he advocating higher taxes through his revenue scheme Gramm Rudman law sets fixed deficit targets Congress aim wiping out huge deficits by but over past two years deficits exceeded targets Senate source Chiles asked cooperation to avoid clashes when Senate House Budget committees start writing separate budget plans congressional approval starting next week source Chiles told Baker If you start working sooner rather than later you chance to do something before everyone gets locked Baker conversations budget problem Senator Pete Domenici New Mexico senior Republican on Senate Budget Committee House Speaker Jim Wright Baker reportedly he plans to further talks other Republicans House Budget Committee Chairman William Gray before White House decides what going to do if anything source House sources Gray who been pushing idea budget summit Reagan is anxious to work White House to get compromise budget plan Besides reaching decisions on actual spending revenue levels new budget congressmen considering adjusting or redefining targets Gramm Rudman law to make them more realistic Reagan presented billion dlrs spending delays cuts revenues he reach billion dlrs Gray if Congress approves billion dlrs reductions deficit be billion dlrs realistically because what he says more accurate economic assumptions

text.author: By Kathleen Hays Reuters

economists If you re Fed there s no reason to do anything Steve Slifer Lehman Government Securities Inc There hints GNP picking up On inflation front all well he Money supply well under control s absolutely ideal situation February U S industrial production rose pct slightly less than pct gain financial markets expected compared slim pct rise January s production number previously reported as pct increase February U S producer price index gained only pct less than pct expected rise followed pct rise PPI January The Fed going to look at positively Allan Leslie Discount Corporation Certainly inflation as bad as what Volcker Fed Chairman lately Industrial production growth along lines what Fed wants energy products component PPI rose pct February after pct increase January This shows impact energy prices on inflation behind us terms move dlrs to dlrs per barrel Maria Ramirez Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc The trend still pct first half year declining energy prices contributed to pct decline PPI Economists rise energy prices expected but sharp drop auto prices Passenger car prices fell pct light truck prices dropped pct Yesterday Federal Reserve Chairman Paul Volcker possibility renewed inflation remains concern both financial markets Federal Reserve The Fed may be lowering own inflation expectations today Robert Brusca Nikko Securities International While low inflation permits Fed to maintain easier monetary policy Brusca if import prices do rise could necessitate weaker dollar The outlook dollar still up air he We need inflation U S producers to compete foreign producers Brusca prices electronic equipment dropped pct February s PPI many electronic goods produced overseas may show foreign producers raising prices bodes ill U S competitiveness he If further dollar declines needed could diminish overseas investment U S debt Brusca added might necessitate higher interest rates lower bond prices By contrast Slifer imported goods prices rose pct first quarter to first quarter reflecting to large degree pct drop trade weighted real value dollar February to February Slifer import prices may rise further as manufacturers contracts put place before dollar dropped to current levels expire new contracts made reflect weaker dollar David Wyss Data Resources Inc noted imported manufactured goods prices rose pct at annual rate second half contributed to rising U S industrial output It s other side lower dollar Wyss Producers beginning to find themselves more competitive they increasing output Wyss latest data point to average industrial production gain pct first quarter It s encouraging sign manufacturing sector beginning to revive But Stephen Roach Morgan Stanley Co Inc convinced February reports portend economic gains He much strength came factors do point to sustained rise industrial output Roach pointed out stikers returning to work farm equipment industries helped account one pct rise February business equipment production Utilities output rose pct February after gaining pct January but Roach shows mostly more energy produced manufacturing activity gained Finally he pointed out auto production accounted half industrial production gain as production auto assemblies rose to million units at annual rate million units In first quarter looks like automakers producing at unit annual rate but selling at roughly seven unit rate Roach The disparity between output sales showing up inventories Economists pointed to sharp rise January U S business inventories as sign production may be outstripping demand first quarter January business inventories rose pct largest gain since July when inventories rose pct Commerce Department Business sales dropped pct January largest monthly sales drop on record Nonetheless economists do expect Fed to react to month to month changes The Fed been standing pat seven months Ramirez They continue to stand pat at least next couple months

text.body: A secondary market resale farm real estate loans similar to markets on home mortgages gaining support Congress among rural lenders could be set up year Congressional financial sources Several bills establish farm secondary market been introduced both House Senate Furthermore Representatives Farm Credit System commercial bankers life insurance companies meeting attempt to agree on method establishing market Frank Naylor chairman Farm Credit Administration FCA regulates farm credit system yesterday farm loan secondary market be positive agriculture as long as farm credit system key player Naylor told House Agriculture subcommittee hearing secondary market could be established either Congressional legislation or administratively Any farm loan secondary market be modeled after successful resale markets home mortgages Government National Mortgage Association GNMA Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation Freddie Mac industry sources Commercial banks life insurance companies main supporters farm loan secondary market since they believe allow private lenders to compete more effectively rural lending quasi government farm credit system traditionally largest lender to farmers farm secondary market allow lenders to sell high quality loans on farmland to poolers who turn package loans issue farm mortgage backed securities resale to investors called Aggie mae by some proponents FCA financially troubled farm credit system past been ambivalent idea mainly because any farm secondary market established private sector excluded farm credit system put system at competitive disadvantage could be another financial blow to system lost billion dlrs two years Naylor farm credit system officials However system FCA become more positive to idea recently because system could benefit if were appointed agent secondary market If farm credit system were guarantor pools farm mortgage loans benefit fees charged providing service Life Insurers study Congressional sources believe secondary market available to both private lenders farm credit system system as agent could be included major federal government rescue package system to be drafted by Congress later year study commissioned by one main supporters secondary market idea American Council Life Insurers concludes farm credit system s market share rural lending fall if secondary market were established study released earlier today study secondary market could be established virtually no federal money if government provided guarantee pct farm loans but private co insurance plan guaranteed first pct any losses estimated between two billion dlrs eight billion new farm real estate loans issued each year qualify secondary market first few years expanding significantly later as investors accept idea study also interest rates charged to farmers who meet underwriting standards secondary market fall to basis points due to new resale market possible interest rate declines major reason why leading U S farm organizations such as American Farm Bureau Federation recently endorsed idea Proponents say secondary market also increase liquidity farm lending spread risk such loans

text.title: BRAZILIAN TROOPS TO LEAVE OIL REFINERIES
text.author: By Stephen Powell Reuters
text.body: Brazil s labour troubles eased little today as authorities announced they were withdrawing troops country s main oil installations occupied three days ago troops went at request state oil company Petrobras because threat strike by oil industry employees Petrobras statement today requested withdrawal troops situation refineries calm employees indicated their willingness to negotiate pay deal national seamen s strike however continued marines remained country s main ports marines were despatched to ports after seamen s strike now two weeks old ruled illegal Friday spokesman at national strike headquarters Rio de Janeiro today total l ships were strike bound Brazil foreign ports Yesterday two small companies specialised transport chemicals Global Flumar struck pay accord their seamen who secured pct increase Brazilian newspapers today hailed these agreements as sign national strike could soon come to end Both companies employ fewer than seamen union leaders vast majority Brazil s seamen were still on strike threat stoppage by oil industry employees appeared today to be receding Petrobras statement company meet union leaders pay talks Rio de Janeiro next Wednesday Labour Minister Almir Pazzionotto act as mediator Besides industrial troubles there also been considerable unrest week agricultural sector On Tuesday hundreds thousands farmers held rallies throughout country to protest against high interest rates Television reports showed some these protests still continuing today farmers blockading banks their vehicles several towns states Sao Paulo Parana strikes Brazil come as government trying to extricate itself serious debt crisis brought on by deterioration trade balance On February President Jose Sarney announced Brazil suspending interest payments on billion dlrs debt to private banks Because seamen strike exports being delayed country losing badly needed foreign exchange

text.title: TALKING POINT BANK STOCKS
text.author: By Cal Mankowski Reuters
text.body: CitiCorp CCI appears to be digging heels tough negotiations over billions dollars loans Brazil owes to money center banks Wall Street analysts I view as pre negotiation posturing analyst Carole Berger Cyrus J Lawrence Inc referring to both Brazil Citicorp Brazil recently stopped paying interest on commercial bank debt Today CitiCorp first quarter income be reduced by dlrs after tax if lists loans as non performing status Citicorp filed K form Securities Exchange Commission indicating material change financial situation Citicorp saying you can t scare us threats we ll make your loans non performing right now Berger loans to be treated as non performing after days without payment CitiCorp only situation be reviewed at end current quarter Berger asserted Brazil doing own politicking by talking to U S regulators trying to drive wedge between U S European banks Analyst Lawrence Cohn Merrill Lynch Co unlikely situation be resolved until second half year Ultimately Brazilians going to to pay up on all interest they owe Cohn The real issue rescheduling debt terms Another question whether or International Monetary Fund can help Brazil new austerity program Stocks money center banks were mostly down fractions late dealings One trader most stocks group bounced off their lows by midday as investors took news stride Cohn bank stocks may be risky until numbers on non performing loans reported each bank But he investors looking ahead six to months might want to buy at present levels tremendous fundamental values group Analyst Robert Gordon Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc Manufacturers Hanover Corp MHC greatest exposure to Brazilian loans any New York bank terms percentage earnings He his only two recommendations currently among New York banks J P Morgan Co JPM Bankers Trust Co BT happen to least exposure Gordon his positive opinion on J P Morgan Bankers Trust merely response to fact two lower exposure to Brazilian loans than other banks fact he there s chance those banks could get more involved future He noted Morgan already set up brokerage subsidiary to deal loans to less developed countries I don t see any reason to change full year earnings estimates Frederick Meinke analyst at E F Hutton Co He thinks confrontation Brazil could end replay situation occurred Argentina Meinke noted case Argentina loans became non accruing couple quarters but then when banks came to agreement Argentina all back interest paid What did distort quarterly earnings pattern he He case Brazil write offs loans worst case outcome highly unlikely He noted Brazil country diversified economy going through some economic upheaval after transition military to civilian government The countries Latin America too much debt relative to their ability to service John Mason Interstate Securities We ve been fiddling around these problems five years hour growing late He up to now banks reduced their spreads cut interest rates internally extended maturities none these measures been enough He expects re classification as much as third loans as non accruing he sees partial write downs some loans Nevertheless Mason thinks money center bank stocks could be poised short term rally spokesman at First Chicago Corp FNB premature to put Brazil s loans on cash basis It our expectation economic development allow Brazil to meet debt spokesman Bankers Trust New York be premature to make decision Several other banks queried by Reuters much same thing spokesman at Manufacturers Hanover noted billion dlrs loan exposure to Brazil only billion subject to Brazil s unilateral moratorium on repayment interest
